intro: Hieracium fulcratum subsp. lillense, commonly known as the Lillense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in meadows, pastures, and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
